definition[0]: prohibitive costs are so high that they prevent people from buying or doing something
example[0]: The cost of land in Tokyo is prohibitive.
definition[1]: a prohibitive rule prevents people from doing things
definition[2]: prohibitive costs, prices etc are very high, and people cannot afford them
example[2]: Given the resources of small companies, marketingcosts can beprohibitive.
example[3]: Disney started its own record label rather than pay a prohibitive price for an existing independent.
